meanings.definition: The state of feeling self-conscious, ashamed, or awkward.
meanings.sent1: Her face turned red with embarrassment when she tripped in front of everyone.
meanings.sent2: He couldn't bear the embarrassment of forgetting his lines during the play.
meanings.sent3: The puppy's attempt to climb the stairs was met with laughter, causing embarrassment to its owner.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds looming overhead were an embarrassment to the bright blue sky of the morning.
meanings.sent5: The embarrassment of being caught singing loudly in the shower stayed with her all day.

meanings.definition: Something that causes a person to feel self-conscious or ashamed.
meanings.sent1: The spilled drink on her dress was an instant source of embarrassment for her.
meanings.sent2: His old-fashioned flip phone was an embarrassment to his tech-savvy friends.
meanings.sent3: The cat's refusal to use the litter box was an embarrassment to its owner, but a source of amusement to the guests.
meanings.sent4: The abandoned building stood as an embarrassment to the once-thriving neighborhood.
meanings.sent5: The misspelled sign outside the store was a public embarrassment for the owner.
